title: ‘We are in this together’: How 8 men in this rural Nepali village are upending gender norms around pregnancy and parenting
text: I don’t like that way of thinking. From the first phone call, I wanted to be involved as much as possible. I asked what tests she was having, and what checks the local nurses were doing to make sure the baby was okay. When she told me that she had been advised not to lift heavy things, I listened very carefully. My goal in life is to take care of my family — not to stick to old-fashioned traditions about who does what around the house. Now that I’m back in Nepal, I’m trying to do as much of the domestic chores as possible, as well as the agricultural work. When our baby is born, I’ll do as much as I can to help raise them too.
description: ‘In the past, men here were totally outcast from anything to do with pregnancy’
